The two reply shots came too fast for Dinobot to dodge. The first hit
him r=
ight in the chest, while the second whizzed right in his blaster
optic. He =
was pushed upwards in the air and landed heavily on his back. 

Dinobot: Th=
at... [grunt] that was... a good... fight. I concede victory.

He hesitantl=
y and slowly got back to a sitting position. His optic was
gone, Blasted aw=
ay by the shot.

Dinobot: If you would be so kind as to offer me the hospit=
ality of one
of your CR chambers, I would be more than grateful. But of cou=
rse,
that will have to wait. As I promised, I have to reveal a lot of
thing=
s, Perseus. 

Farther, Doc was itchy with his rifle. He had quickly resight=
ed
Dinobot as he went down and did not move the barrel of his weapon by a
m=
illimeter.

Doc: Rodimus, I really don't like this guy. We should at least =
send
someone down there with Perseus to handle him in case he tries to pull=

a trick.
